newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Feb 4.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Feb 4.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

The Estate Mortgage case finally got under way in Victorian Supreme Court on Monday. The new trustees of the failed trusts is claiming Burns Philp should be held liable for the actions of its trustee company in the collapse of the Estate Mortgage trusts.

Newspapers report the big Australian as about to sell its 43.75 percent stake in Vietnam's offshore Dai Hung oil project to Malaysia's Petronas. BHP refuses to comment. The company fully wrote down its A$151 million investment in its 1995/96 accounts.
On Monday, engineering group reported a 50 percent jump in half year net profit to A$9.09 million and forecast another record result for its full year.
Technology ERG said on Monday its AES Prodata subsidiary had won a plus A$5 million contract to install the next generation fare collection systems for the Sydney harbour ferry network.
